speaker: Apiza
text: You can save the state of the keyboard specified at the time the function is called into the structure pointed to by ret_state, using al_get_keyboard_state

speaker: Programmer
text: Whats the function signature for al_get_keyboard_state

text: void al_get_keyboard_state(ALLEGRO_KEYBOARD_STATE *ret_state)

speaker: Programmer
text: Documentation for ALLEGRO_KEYBOARD_STATE

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_KEYBOARD_STATE is a structure that is used to hold a "snapshot" of a keyboard\'s state at a particular instant.

speaker: Apiza
text: It contains the following publicly readable fields: display - points to the display that had keyboard focus at the time the state was saved. If no display was focused, this points to NULL.

speaker: Programmer
text: How do you load an audio sample in Allegro?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_load_sample loads a few different audio file formats based on their extension.\nNote that this stores the entire file in memory at once, which may be time consuming. To read the file as it is needed, use al_load_audio_stream.\n

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns the sample on success, NULL on failure.

speaker: Programmer
text: Function signature for al_load_sample()

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *al_load_sample(const char *filename)

speaker: Programmer
text: Function signature for al_play_sample()

speaker: Apiza
text: bool al_play_sample(ALLEGRO_SAMPLE *spl, float gain, float pan, float speed,\n ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE loop, ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID *ret_id)

speaker: Programmer
text: What is ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID

speaker: Apiza
text: An ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_ID represents a sample being played via al_play_sample. It can be used to later stop the sample with al_stop_sample. The underlying ALLEGRO_SAMPLE_INSTANCE can be extracted using al_lock_sample_id.

speaker: Programmer
text: What is ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE ?

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE is an enum.

speaker: Programmer
text: Enumerate ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE

speaker: Apiza
text: Sample and stream playback mode.

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_ONCE, ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_LOOP, ALLEGRO_PLAYMODE_BIDIR

speaker: Programmer
text: Why is al_play_sample() returning false?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_play_sample plays a sample on one of the sample instances created by al_reserve_samples.

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true on success, false on failure.

speaker: Apiza
text: Playback may fail because all the reserved sample instances are currently used.

speaker: Programmer
text: function signature for al_reserve_samples()

speaker: Apiza
text: bool al_reserve_samples(int reserve_samples)

speaker: Programmer
text: How do you load a font in allegro?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_load_font loads a font from disk. This will use al_load_bitmap_font_flags if you pass the name of a known bitmap format, or else al_load_ttf_font.\nThe flags parameter is passed through to either of those functions. Bitmap and TTF fonts are also affected by the current bitmap flags at the time the font is loaded.

speaker: Programmer
text: function signature for al_load_font

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_FONT *al_load_font(char const *filename, int size, int flags)

speaker: Programmer
text: List al_load_bitmap_font_flags

speaker: Apiza
text: al_load_bitmap_font_flags like al_load_bitmap_font but additionally takes a flags parameter which is a bitfield containing a combination of the following:\nALLEGRO_NO_PREMULTIPLIED_ALPHA\n

speaker: Apiza
text: The same meaning as for al_load_bitmap_flags.

speaker: Programmer
text: Do I need to initialize allegro for ttf fonts?

speaker: Apiza
text: al_init_ttf_addon call this after al_init_font_addon to make al_load_font recognize ".ttf" and other formats supported by al_load_ttf_font.

speaker: Apiza
text: Returns true on success, false on failure.

speaker: Programmer
text: Allegro render ttf font

speaker: Programmer
text: How to draw an ALLEGRO_FONT to backbuffer?

speaker: Apiza
text: ALLEGRO_FONT is a handle identifying any kind of font.

speaker: Apiza
text: Usually you will create it with al_load_font which supports loading all kinds of TrueType fonts supported by the FreeType library.

speaker: Apiza
text: If you instead pass the filename of a bitmap file, it will be loaded with al_load_bitmap and a font in Allegro's bitmap font format will be created from it with al_grab_font_from_bitmap.

speaker: Programmer
text: How do you draw an ALLEGRO_FONT instance?

speaker: Apiza
text: Are you interested in al_draw_textf?
